pyutil.batch_renamer module¶

Renames a directory of files based on a template

Largely argparse and doctest practice. From pydocs tutorials stdlib2. Reformatted. Still uses old style strings as a result.

First things first ensure it works at all. Then add some doctests.

>>> import doctest
>>> doctest.docmod()

Then build up the module. Add arg to handle different string template.

class pyutil.batch_renamer.BatchRename(template)[source]¶

Bases: string.Template

delimiter = '%'¶
pattern = re.compile('\n %(?:\n (?P<escaped>%) | # Escape sequence of two delimiters\n (?P<named>(?a:[_a-z][_a-z0-9]*)) | # delimiter and a Python identifier\n {(?P<braced>(?a:[_a-z][_a-z0-9]*)), re.IGNORECASE|re.VERBOSE)¶
pyutil.batch_renamer.fix_extension()[source]¶

Basically a batch renamer.

pyutil.batch_renamer.main(d)[source]¶

Renames a dir of files.
